content.question: A student is at rest on a stool that may freely spin about its central axis of rotation. As the stool spins, the student holds onto two dumbbells as the stool spins at an angular speed of <math alttext="1.2 radians per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.2</mn><mtext> rad/s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> with the student’s arms completely stretched out from the student’s body. At this instant, the student-dumbbell system has rotational inertia of <math alttext="6 kilogram meter squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>kg</mtext><mo>·</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>2</mtext></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. The student then brings their arms close to their body, and rotational inertia of the student-dumbbell system is changed to <math alttext="2 kilogram meter squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mtext> </mtext><mtext>kg</mtext><mo>·</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>m</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>2</mtext></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is the new angular speed of the student?

choices.label: <math alttext="0.4 radian per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.4</mn><mtext> rad/s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="1.2 radians per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.2</mn><mtext> rad/s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="3.6 radians per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3.6</mn><mtext> rad/s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="7.2 radians per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>7.2</mn><mtext> rad/s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="3.6 radians per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>3.6</mn><mtext> rad/s</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>
